DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective pilot study examine effect consume whole grain , differ degree processing , insulin sensitivity cardiometabolic risk factor . The overall aim ass feasibility test diet generate preliminary data .
DOC.detailed_description: In pilot study , investigator access feasibility generate preliminary data systematically address major question nutrition : Does food processing , specifically regard whole grain ( WGs ) , independent effect outcomes related diabetes cardiovascular disease ? Whole grain define intact , ground , crack , flake caryopsis ( kernel seed ) , principal component ( bran , endosperm , germ ) present proportion intact caryopsis . In contrast , refine grain ( RGs ) mill remove bran germ , leave endosperm result low fiber , iron , many B vitamin . Several previous study show consumption WGs vs. RGs improve insulin sensitivity decrease risk chronic disease . However , effect consume WGs may differ depend degree processing . While whole grain product contain three component kernel , hypothesize consume food contain least processed ( least pulverize ) kernel may beneficial effect metabolism decrease disease risk plausible physiological mechanism . The investigator propose partial feeding study use randomize 3-period crossover design compare effect 1 ) intact minimally process whole grain , 2 ) highly process whole grain , 3 ) refine grain , feed 4 week . The primary outcome change peripheral insulin sensitivity . Secondary outcome include hepatic insulin sensitivity , component metabolic syndrome cardiometabolic risk factor , arterial stiffness , gut microbiome fecal short chain fatty acid , rating hunger , satiation , palatability , acceptability ( gastrointestinal symptom ) .
DOC.criteria: Aged 18 35 year Body mass index ≥ 25 < 40 kg/m2 Serum fast insulin > 10 uIU/mL one follow metabolic syndrome component : waist circumference , men : ≥102 cm , woman : ≥88 cm ; triglyceride , ≥150 mg/dL ; HDLC , men : < 40 mg/dL , woman : < 50 mg/dL ; systolic blood pressure ≥130 diastolic blood pressure ≥85 mmHg ; fast glucose , ≥100 mg/dL Medical clearance primary care provider rule major medical illness , disability , disorder ( e.g. , liver disease , renal failure , cancer ) Access work telephone cell phone Willingness eat grain food provide participation If female , regular menstrual cycle ( defined 2630 day , ±1 day full flow , i.e . 26 30 day cycle ; one day variation duration menstrual flow ) Preexisting major medical illness medical history laboratory screen test Allergy sensitivity gluten ( selfreported physician diagnose ) > 5 % change weight within previous 6 month Current smoking ( 1 cigarette past week ) Major surgery within previous 6 month Physical , mental , cognitive handicap prevent participation . Alcohol intake > 7 drink per week Use medication may affect study outcome Use antibiotic within previous 3 month ( agree complete analysis gut microbiome fecal short chain fatty acid ) Use illegal drug Plans away home 1 week longer study period ( e.g. , vacation , relocation ) Another member family ( first degree relative ) household participate study If female , pregnancy lactation prior 12 month , plan become pregnant study period , change oral contraceptive within 3 month , irregular menstrual cycle frequency ( < 10 bleeds/year )
